page.title: 05HOUSING IN THE SUCKLEY AREA
page.content:
{
Suckley and its environs has only one area of housing at Longley Green, some of the cottages dating from the 14th century. The rest of the area is devoted to farms, many of which have recently converted outhouses, oast houses and barns into residential accommodation.
Two small pockets of council housing have been constructed - one of 'Airey' houses, built during the Second World War and an adjoining collection of retirement bungalows.
The only housing development now permitted is a certain amount of infilling at Longley Green.
